metadata.title: CVE-2020-14350 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
It was found that some PostgreSQL extensions did not use search_path safelyin their installation script. An attacker with sufficient privileges coulduse this flaw to trick an administrator into executing a specially craftedscript, during the installation or update of such extension. This affectsPostgreSQL versions before 12.4, before 11.9, before 10.14, before 9.6.19,and before 9.5.23.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-14350` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libecpg-compat3 - 10.14-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
libecpg6 - 10.14-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
libpgtypes3 - 10.14-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
libpq5 - 10.14-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
postgresql-10 - 10.14-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
postgresql-client-10 - 10.14-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
postgresql-plperl-10 - 10.14-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
postgresql-plpython-10 - 10.14-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
postgresql-plpython3-10 - 10.14-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
postgresql-pltcl-10 - 10.14-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: postgresql-10 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '10.14-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
